solution_line_template: He has 25% of his take-home pay automatically enrolled into his 401k so that's {retirement_percent_decimal}*{gross_pay} = $<<{retirement_percent_decimal}*{gross_pay}={retirement_deduction}>>{retirement_deduction}

His take-home pay is ${gross_pay}.00 and ${retirement_deduction}.00 is taken out for retirement so that leaves {gross_pay}-{retirement_deduction} = $<<{gross_pay}-{retirement_deduction}={pay_after_retirement}>>{pay_after_retirement}

They also take ${tax_deduction}.00 out of his paycheck for taxes so his paycheck will be issued for {pay_after_retirement}-{tax_deduction} = $<<{pay_after_retirement}-{tax_deduction}={final_paycheck_amount}>>{final_paycheck_amount}
